required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Induced Moderate HYPOthermia on Mortality in Cardiogenic Shock Patients Rescued by Veno-arterial ExtraCorporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO)
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Induced Moderate HYPOthermia on Mortality in Cardiogenic Shock Patients Rescued by Veno-arterial ExtraCorporeal Membrane Oxygenation (ECMO)

brief_summary.textblock:
A multicenter, prospective, controlled, randomized (moderate hypothermia 33°C≤ T°C ≤34°C) during 24 hours ± 1h versus normothermia (36°C≤ T°C ≤37°C), comparative open trial will be conducted on two parallel groups of patients with cardiogenic shock treated with VA-ECMO.
The HYPO-ECMO trial will test the hypothesis that moderate hypothermia (temperature between 33°C≤ T°C ≤34°C) associated with VA-ECMO support results in a reduction in 30-day mortality in comparison with the normothermia group (36°C≤ T°C ≤37°C).

primary_outcome.description: The study objective is to determine whether early moderate hypothermia (33°C≤ T°C ≤34°C) is superior to normothermia (37°C ± 0.3°C) in patients with cardiogenic shock treated with VA-ECMO with respect to 30-day mortality

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on mortality during hospitalization and up to 180 days

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 180 days (from date of randomization until ECMO weaning)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on VA-ECMO weaning time
Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on adverse cardiovascular events
Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on adverse cardiovascular events

secondary_outcome.measure: escalation to Left Ventricular Assist Device
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on adverse cardiovascular events
Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on adverse cardiovascular events

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 180 days (from date of randomization until ECMO weaning)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on necessity of fluid

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 180 days (from date of randomization until ECMO weaning)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on necessity of vasopressor (norepinephrine, epinephrine)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 180 days (from date of randomization until ECMO weaning)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on lactate clearance
Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on duration of organ failure
Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on mechanical ventilation support use

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline until day 30, day 60, day 180
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on renal replacement therapy use
Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on duration of ICU stay
Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on duration of total hospitalization
Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on the risk of bleeding under ECMO
Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on the risk of bleeding under ECMO
Evaluation of the impact of moderate hypothermia on risk of sepsis (pulmonary, blood, venous lines, cannulaes)

arm_group.description: Moderate hypothermia :Patients with cardiogenic shock treated with arteriovenous ECMO to a strategy of moderate hypothermia during 24 hours (Temperature at 33°C≤ T°C ≤34°C) associated with usual care
Normothermia: Patients with cardiogenic shock treated with arteriovenous ECMO to a strategy of normothermia (36°C≤ T°C ≤37°C) associated with usual care

intervention.description: moderate hypothermia will be induced using the heat controller of the VA-ECMO circuit. Temperature will be maintained between 33°C≤ T°C ≤34°C during 24 hours ± 1h followed by a progressive reheating (0.2±0.1°C/h) to reach 37 °C. Temperature at 37°C ± 0.3°C will be maintained during 48 hours ± 4h after having reached 37 °C.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Intubated patients with cardiogenic shock treated with VA-ECMO
- Patient affiliated to social security plan
Exclusion Criteria:
- VA-ECMO after cardiac surgery for heart transplantation or lung transplantation or left or biventricular assist device implantation
- VA-ECMO for acute poisoning with cardio-toxic drugs
- Pregnancy
- Uncontrolled bleeding (bleeding despite medical intervention (surgery or drugs))
- Implantation of VA ECMO under cardiac massage with a duration of cardiac massage >45minutes
- Out of hospital refractory cardiac arrest
- Cerebral deficit with fixed dilated pupils
- Participation in another interventional research involving therapeutic modifications
- Patient moribund on the day of randomization
- Irreversible neurological pathology
- Minor patients
- Patients under tutelage

facility.name: CHU Toulouse Hôpital - Pierre Paul Riquet
